SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc31
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.model.gameModel

Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.model.gameModel.GameModel
public class GameModel extends Object
This class represents the game model of the application. It contains the game board and a map of players. It also has a static variable pawnSelector for assigning pawn colors to players.

  • Field Details

    • board

      private final Board board
      It is the game board, where the decks are kept and where the players' scores are kept track of

    • pawnSelector

      private int pawnSelector
      Is used to assign the color of the pieces to the players

    • players

      protected Map<String,Player> players
      Represents a collection of players in a game. This variable is used to store a mapping of player names to player objects. The key of the map is the player name, and the value is the player object.

    • clients

      protected Map<String,VirtualClient> clients
      A protected variable that represents the mapping of client identities to their corresponding virtual clients.

      The clients mapping is implemented as a Java HashMap, where the client identity is used as the key and the VirtualClient object is used as the value.

    • clientListLock

      protected final Object clientListLock
      Lock object that is used to synchronize with the clientList map to avoid concurrency problems

    • commonObjectives

      protected List<ObjectiveCard> commonObjectives
      List of common objectives. At the end of the game these objectives assign the corresponding score to the players who achieved them

    • turnPlayer

      protected List<String> turnPlayer
      It is used to set the order of the players' turns

    • playerConnection

      protected final Map<String,Boolean> playerConnection
      It is a map that associates player names with their connection status. The connection status is represented by a Boolean value, where true indicates that the player is currently connected, and false indicates that the player is currently disconnected.

      It is initialized as ConcurrentMap to allow access and modification without concurrency issues

      If a player is disconnected then his boolean value is set to false

    • currPlayingPlayer

      private int currPlayingPlayer
      Index of the player who is playing

    • gameState

      protected GameModelState gameState
      Represents the state of the game.

    • listeners

      private final Map<String,GameListenerHandler> listeners
      Contains the listeners of the players in the game and each gameListenerHandler takes care of updates about a player.

    • isStarted

      private boolean isStarted
      Indicates whether the game has been started or not.

    • idGame

      private final int idGame
      The idGame variable represents the identification number of a game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameModel

      public GameModel(Object clientListLock, int idGame)
      Constructor for the GameModel class. It sets the state of the GameModel to CreationGameModelState.

  • Method Details

    • initGame

      public void initGame(Map<String,VirtualClient> clients, Object lock) throws IllegalStateOperationException
      Initializes the game.
      Parameters:
      clients - a LinkedHashMap containing the virtual clients mapped with their usernames
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state to be initialized

    • endGame

      public void endGame(String lastPlayerConnected) throws IllegalStateOperationException
      Ends the game.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state to be ended

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn() throws IllegalStateOperationException
      Ends the current turn of the game. This method detects if the game has ended, sets the next playing player, and notifies player score and player turn listeners. Disconnected players are skipped so the rest of the players can play
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state

    • setNextPlayingPlayer

      public void setNextPlayingPlayer()
      Sets the next playing player. If the turnPlayer is null, which means that it is the first time this method is called, it initializes the turnPlayer list with all the players and sets the currPlayingPlayer index to 0. Otherwise, it increments the currPlayingPlayer index by 1 and wraps it around if it exceeds the number of players. Once it finds the next playing player, sets the state of all players to waiting, while the state of the new current player is set to not placed.

    • pawnAssignment

      protected PawnColor pawnAssignment()
      Assigns a pawn color to a player. It uses the static variable pawnSelector to determine the color. The pawnSelector is incremented after each assignment.
      Returns:
      The PawnColor assigned to the player.

    • chooseSecretObjective

      public void chooseSecretObjective(String username, Integer index) throws IllegalStateOperationException
      Chooses the secret objective for a player.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player
      index - The index of the secret objective card to be chosen
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state to choose a secret objective

    • playStarter

      public void playStarter(String username) throws IllegalStateOperationException, ObjectiveCardNotChosenException
      Plays the starter card for the specified username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state
      ObjectiveCardNotChosenException - if the player has not chosen a secret objective card yet

    • play

      public void play(String username, Point point) throws IllegalStateOperationException, IllegalPlaceCardException
      Plays a card on the game board for a specified player.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      point - the location on the game board where the card will be placed
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state for playing a card
      IllegalPlaceCardException - if the card cannot be placed at the specified location

    • drawGold

      public void drawGold(String username, int index) throws IllegalStateOperationException, EmptyDeckException
      Draws a gold card from the deck for a specific player.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      index - the index of the gold card to be drawn
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state for drawing a gold card
      EmptyDeckException

    • drawResource

      public void drawResource(String username, int index) throws IllegalStateOperationException, EmptyDeckException
      Draws a resource card from the deck for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      index - the index of the resource card to be drawn
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state for drawing a resource card
      EmptyDeckException

    • setSelectCard

      public void setSelectCard(String username, int index) throws IllegalStateOperationException, WrongIndexSelectedCard
      Sets the selected card of the hand for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      index - the index of the selected card
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state
      WrongIndexSelectedCard - if the selected index is wrong

    • changeSide

      public void changeSide(String username) throws IllegalStateOperationException
      Changes the side of the selected card for the player with the given username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state to change the side

    • changStarterSide

      public void changStarterSide(String username) throws IllegalStateOperationException
      Changes the starter side for the player with the given username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      Throws:
      IllegalStateOperationException - if the game is not in the right state to change the starter side

    • disconnectPlayer

      public void disconnectPlayer(String username) throws LastPlayerRemainedException
      Disconnects a player from the game based on the game state.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player who disconnected
      Throws:
      LastPlayerRemainedException

    • reconnectPlayer

      public void reconnectPlayer(String username)
      Reconnects a player to the game based on the game state.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player to reconnect.

    • executeReconnectPlayer

      protected void executeReconnectPlayer(String username)
      Executes the reconnection of a player by setting their connection status to true in the playerConnection map. Also logs the reconnection information in the server log.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player to reconnect.

    • executeDisconnectPlayer

      protected void executeDisconnectPlayer(String username) throws LastPlayerRemainedException
      Executes the disconnection of a player by setting their connection status to false in the playerConnection map. If the disconnected player is the current turn player, it draw a default card if necessary and set the next playing player. If the game is in the setup state (turnPlayer == null), it makes default decisions for the secret objective card and for the placement of the starter card. If the disconnected player is not the current turn player, it does nothing.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player who disconnected
      Throws:
      LastPlayerRemainedException - if the player is the last one in the game, set the status of the game to BlockedGameModelState and throws the exception.

    • notifyAllGameListeners

      public void notifyAllGameListeners()
      Notifies all game listeners. This method invokes the notifyAllListeners method of each listener in the listeners map.

    • getPlayerConnection

      public Map<String,Boolean> getPlayerConnection()
      Returns a map representing the connection status of each player.
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are the usernames of the players and the values are booleans indicating their connection status.

    • isStarted

      public boolean isStarted()
      Check if the game has started.
      Returns:
      true if the game has started, false otherwise.

    • getIdGame

      public int getIdGame()
      Retrieves the ID of the game.
      Returns:
      the ID of the game

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Retrieves the game board.
      Returns:
      The game board.

    • getPlayers

      public Map<String,Player> getPlayers()
      Retrieves the map of players in the game.
      Returns:
      a Map<String, Player> where the keys are the usernames of the players and the values are the Player objects.

    • getCurrPlayer

      protected Player getCurrPlayer()
      Retrieves the player currently playing. The current player is null if the turn has not yet started, then the game has not yet been set to RunningGameModelSate.
      Returns:
      The current player, or null if there is no current player.

    • getCurrIndexPlayer

      protected int getCurrIndexPlayer()
      Retrieves the current index of the player who is currently playing.
      Returns:
      The current index of the playing player.

    • setGameState

      public void setGameState(GameModelState gameState)
      Sets the game state of the GameModel.
      Parameters:
      gameState - The new game state to be set.

    • getCommonObjectives

      public List<ObjectiveCard> getCommonObjectives()
      Returns the list of common objective cards in the game.
      Returns:
      A list of ObjectiveCard objects representing the common objectives.

    • getListeners

      public Map<String,GameListenerHandler> getListeners()
      Returns a map containing the listeners registered for the game.
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are the names of the listeners and the values are the corresponding GameListenerHandler objects.

    • getGameState

      GameModelState getGameState()
      Retrieves the current State of the game
